div.div: Long-term trends in predator-prey indices at East Bay Mainland.
div.p: Trends in light goose, gull, jaeger, arctic fox, and lemming sightings per 8-hour person day at East Bay Mainland. Lemming numbers peaked in 2001, 2008 and 2014. In most other years, lemmings were rarely recorded. Sighting indices have been scaled for the purposes of visualization.
